employees.notes: Proff lists the legal entity with 548 employees ("Antall ansatte 548"). [1]

revenue.notes: Proff reports "Sum driftsinntekter 2024 1 676 027" and states "Beløp i 1000", so revenue is interpreted as NOK thousands. [1]

company.entity_resolution_notes: Entity matched as Norwegian AS via Proff legal name and organization number; the same Odda smelter is referenced on Boliden’s site. [1][2]

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Boliden Odda explicitly states recycled zinc as a secondary raw material input, and Boliden reports substantial zinc output from secondary materials (~20%), indicating meaningful SRM use. [2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Zinc-bearing secondary industrial residues
material_examples: Processed residual materials from scrap steel recycling
srm_inputs.used_for: Used as secondary feed in Odda’s zinc refining/smelting process to produce pure zinc. [2][3]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: Boliden states 35,000-40,000 tonnes of pure zinc annually from secondary materials, around 20% of total zinc production, which supports meaningful but not dominant dependence. [3]

share.context: The published proportion is stated as a share of total zinc production at Odda. [3]

srm_inputs.volume_notes: Publicly disclosed figures are output-linked (zinc produced from secondary materials), not direct inbound feedstock tonnage. [3]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: No direct annual mass of incoming secondary feedstock to Odda is disclosed in the reviewed public sources. [2][3]

gaps_and_uncertainties: No source found with direct inbound SRM tonnage (received/purchased secondary feedstock) for the legal entity/site. [2][3]
The 20% figure is presented in a case-study narrative without a clearly stated reference year. [3]
